alert.note: Alert for Allendale; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton; Inland Berkeley; Inland Colleton; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, Allendale, Charleston, Coastal Colleton, Dorchester, Hampton, Inland Berkeley, Inland Colleton and Tidal Berkeley. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous to widespread showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will impact the area this afternoon and evening as a cold front drops into the region. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches will be possible with localized higher amounts. The ground remains quite wet from several days of heavy rainfall and additional heavy rain could produce areas of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be prepared to protect life and property, especially in areas prone to flooding. If flooding develops, move to higher ground immediately. If driving, be prepared for flooded roadways and possible road closures.

area.areaDesc: Allendale; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton; Inland Berkeley; Inland Colleton; Tidal Berkeley
